column9: The church is very centally located but very easy to overlook as its a bit hidden behind the central railway station. Always nice flowers around the church and beautiful inside
Just outside the train station, so it is difficult to miss it. Besides the church, don't forget to visit the beautiful graveyard around it. So nicely well kept, and peaceful.

Considering the fact that this church is very central (next to the train station), it's very easy to overlook it. It's well worth a visit if you have 20 minutes to spare while waiting for your train, or if you just want a moment of...More
Beautiful building and surroundings. The service at the church is nice and cozy as well. It is at 18.00 on Sundays which makes it a very student friendly time.

column7: One of two medieval churches left in Lund
column9: Klosterkyrkan is usually open during the day.  It is in the center of Lund and close to the railroad station.  A good place to spend a quiet moment and feel history.
Klosterkyrkan is St. Peter's Priory in English. This is a very old church. The original church was built in 1160s and was built of sandstone with the rounded arches. It is truly beautiful!

column7: One of Lund's most beautiful relics from the Middle Ages
